events.name: Friday Hacks #107 - Secure, high speed Wi Fi using light-bulbs
events.description:
This Friday, we're inviting Eeshan and Shuvan, two PhD's attempting to commercialize their patented Li-Fi technology. 

Imagine converting every light-bulb around you into a secure, high-speed Wi-Fi router. This technology is known as visible light communication, or "Li-Fi",  and is an integral component in the future of wireless communication. Li-Fi has been around for a few years, but hasn't yet reached the marketplace mainly because of its slow speed. At NUS, they have broken down this barrier by developing a plasmonic-enhanced LED bulb capable of streaming data up to 10x quicker than Wi-Fi. In this talk they will cover the basics of Li-Fi communication, their patented technology, and then open it up to the floor for a discussion.

Free pizza as usual!

http://nushackers.org/2016/02/friday-hacks-107-Feb-12/

Friday Hacks is sponsored by the NUS Enterprise Center.

If you are looking to turn your ideas into a startup and would love some business support, feel free to get in touch with Agustiadi from NUS Enterprise: agustiadi@nus.edu.sg
events.location: Video Conferencing Room, School of Computing, National University of Singapore

events.name: UX TL;DR #3
events.description:
UX TL;DR is a learning event where everyone participates! Have you ever come across something new in UX, had the browser tab open for weeks, but never found time to research it? Use this event as an excuse to dig a little deeper. Please bring a laptop or sketchbook. Join to level-up your design and research knowledge, meet other UXers, or learn about the methods used by designers and researchers at the venue. 


7:00 PM - Arrival, seating, & drinks  7:15 PM - Intro talk by the host  7:30 PM - R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new  9:00 PM - Q&A: share what your team learned  9:30 - 10:00 PM - The end
events.location: General Assembly Singapore, The Working Capitol, 1 Keong Saik Road, Level 3, Singapore 089101 (Turn left on the side lane beside Lollapalooza and walk up to

events.name: Getting started - Designing Video Content for Social Media Marketing
events.description:
How do you break through the clutter of video content being created on a daily basis on social media. If you are a thought leader, an entrepreneur or even a layman with a serious message to tell, how do you use video to send a message across. Is the word “viral” a good thing? Is this something that can be made?

You don’t need advanced video editing skills, or the most expensive camera to get started with creating value-centric content for social media. All you need is a clear message and a smart phone at the very least.

Learn the thought process behind designing video content that would resonate with your target audience, use your authentic voice to communicate a message and use a specific strategy to build your audience.

There will also be a Q&A session after the talk.

Register here
https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-feb-meeting-2016-tickets-20884588366

events.name: TGIFHacks #45
events.description:
This week at TGIFHacks, we will be learning the basics of arduino!

Arduino is an extremely popular microcontroller that has many various applications such as DIY technology, robotics, and even product design. 

In this workshop, we will be teaching the basics of Arduino, and what are the possible things you could do with this small microcontroller. Do come down and learn more about the wonders of Arduino!

There is no setup required for the workshop, just bring your laptop! If you do have your own arduino sets and have no idea how to start, or just simply have queries, do bring them down too!

Refreshments will be provided!

events.name: Ethereum Singapore: Lithan Start-up Insights (Keynote Talk)
events.description: Hi fellow Etherians, Welcome to the first event of 2016. This event is held by Lithan, titled Insights. (see https://www.lithan.com/ and the official event link at (http://sites.lithan.com/startupinsights/?src=meetup) There will be 2 keynote segments during the talk, with the thematic focus on Bitcoin and Blockchain application to startups.  This page has also been supported under, IoT Singapore, Singapore's largest and most active IoT group.  http://www.meetup.com/IoT_Singapore/ The first keynote speaker will be Meinhard Benn, who founded SatoshiPay, a bitcoin nanopayments processor aiming to fundamentally change the way web content is monetised. As open source developer, social entrepreneur and avid shoestring traveller with 50 countries under his belt, Meinhard experienced the need for a global and decentralised currency first-hand. He already experimented with different alternative monetary systems for years when bitcoin crossed his path in 2011. As miner, trader, developer and speaker he pushes the cryptocurrency ecosystem forward ever since.  https://satoshipay.io/ The second keynote speaker will be myself, Shaun Djie, co-lead organiser of this group and a Business Development specialist at DigixGlobal, our page's sponsor. I will be speaking from an educational perspective to the budding entrepreneurs at the event (as SBUC is largely student, academic attendees in general), and describing the business model and products offered at DigixGlobal.  https://dgx.io/ I will be confirming more details of this event in the very near future, and look forward to answering any questions you may have through the forum. I've created a Slack channel, the domain name is ethereumSG.slack.com, alternatively, you may drop your email in the comment box below and I can send you an invite. See you on Slack and at the event, Best Regards,Shaun Djie
events.location: Lithan Accelerator, Launchpad@one-north Blk 79, Ayer Rajah Crescent #04-04 Singapore 139955
